item.title: Report X-2023080996
item.description:
Report X-2023080996

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: HORSHAM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 10 POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING 10 X 5 ML VIALS OF EXOVEX REVIVE 5B. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS A ULINE INSULATED SHIPPER PREPRINTED RUSH, PERISHABLE, INSULATED AND UP ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

Further investigation discovered that the drum had been slightly punctured by another piece of freight during transit which consequently contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report X-2023082017
item.description:
Report X-2023082017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received from the BREI SMARTPOST unload at the end of TWILIGHT shift by their equipment operator and dropped off on a pallet next to control room. Package was immediately to the HAZMAT cage. DescribePack: Loose cap, improper shipping, and no packaging on the inside were deemed to be the cause of the leak. It was also the wrong service type. EXPRESS/SMARTPOST barcodes were on the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent powder was placed on the leak on the pallet.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package is a damaged RTS from RLTO. Package was discovered on the Flex slide and pulled to the side due to it being wet. Upon further investigation of the inner contents, one of 1 gallon of product had a loose cap and leaked. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in a hazardous materials bag and drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080972
item.description:
Report E-2023080972

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLF experienced a five-gallon release of UN1760 “Pursuit-XP” from a 275-gallon poly tote that due to an open nozzle. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting a 25’ x 6’ area on the trailer floor. The valve was closed and the tote was wiped down. Crew confirmed the tote was no longer releasing once secured and was shipped on. Spilfyter was utilized to neutralize the impacted and and oil dri was then deployed to collect all released product. All impacted absorbents and impacted wood were then collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was left on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: BREINIGSVILLE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME TO QA FROM OUBOUNDS LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION THERE WAS NO DOT HAZARDOUS DIAMOND ON BOX. QA ADMIN LOOKED UP SDS TO DISCOVER THE PRODUCT WAS CONSIDERED A CORROSIVE. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA CAGE FOR PROCESSING DescribePack: 1 GALLON HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING ABOUT HALF OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN A QA TOTE AND THEN BROUGHT TO CAGE AND TRANSFERRED TO DRUM

item.description:

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on the load side when found. Package was repacked in a mattress box when found. Bottom portion of box was wet and leaking a large amount of gasoline. DescribePack: The used lawnmower inside of the box was missing the gas cap and contents leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package leaked out all gasoline and was cleaned using proper PPE.

item.title: Report X-2023080927
item.description:
Report X-2023080927

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Package came off of trailer# 454830 already damaged/leaking. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of wave solder flux. 1 gallon plastic bottle of wave solder flux had a loose cap allowing .10 gallons to release. The other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of wave solder flux were not damaged. There were slotted partitions but no absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 gallon plastic bottle of wave solder flux had a loose cap leaking out .10 gallons of wave solder flux. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080837
item.description:
Report X-2023080837

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: HUNKER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During transpiration back to the station, the bucket tipped over and rolled inside the truck, striking a bolt causing the perfect circle puncture. With some spillage in truck (Unknow cleanup). Upon arriving to work to check our VSA cart which drivers leave packages that are marked for QA service, I noticed a hazmat bucket lying on it side. Further investigating I saw a small hole at the bottom of the plastic pail. I placed a red hazmat bin on top on the bucket to prevent other packages being placed around it. Procced to acquire a yellow barrel, hazmat bags, gloves, inner stuffing and, absorb pads. Placed gloves on hands and placed absorb pads around leakage on the VSA cart, lifted plastic drum into red hazmat bin for processing, processed and placed into yellow drum with inner fillings and into hazmat cage. DescribePack: Small screw sized hold 1/2 inch from bottom of drum. inward puncture DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was placed on side, using absorb pad and tape to prevent excess spillage during transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023080827
item.description:
Report X-2023080827

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the unload, within the belly of a pup trailer. Upon further investigation, 1 of 4, 1 gallon containers had a loose cap and leaked. Package was immediately reported to unload manager and QA was called. Package was placed into a hazardous materials bag and bin for further processing. DescribePack: One container had a loose cap resulting in a leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in a hazardous materials bag, and use of gloves throughout the processing of the package.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found on the dock leaking. The box was closed, but a white color liquid was leaking from the bottom of the box. The hazmat was put into a bin to stop the spreading and place in the damage hazmat cage. The box was opened and inside there was a open paint can. DescribePack: The lid on the paint can inside the box, came off causing the paint to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed into a bin and put into the damage hazmat cage.
